newsitem.title: USA: Bell Atlantic NYNEX Mobile starts service.
newsitem.headline: Bell Atlantic NYNEX Mobile starts service.

text.p: Bell Atlantic NYNEX Mobile said Tuesday it has begun offering digital cellular phone service in the Washington/Baltimore, Pittsburgh and Charlotte, N.C. markets. The new wireless service, which uses 13-kilobit Code Division Multiple Access, will be made available in all the company's other markets by mid-1997, it said.

The company is offering Qualcomm handheld digital telephones starting at $199 in the three start-up markets. Bell Atlantic earlier said the mobile phone service it owns with NYNEX added a million new customers in 1996, for a total of 4.4 million.
